title: Simplify login flow and improve user experience

requirements.text: Replace the AccessDeniedScreen full-page blocking approach with an inline authentication prompt that allows users to see the application content while displaying a prominent sign-in banner or modal overlay

quotes: Allow for the logging in it's still difficult to log in please

acceptanceCriteria: Users can view application content without being completely blocked by AccessDeniedScreen
A prominent, non-intrusive sign-in prompt is displayed for unauthenticated users
The sign-in prompt clearly explains the benefits of logging in and has a single-click Internet Identity button

requirements.text: Add automatic login persistence that immediately authenticates users when they return to the application if they have an active Internet Identity session, without requiring manual login

quotes: Allow for the logging in it's still difficult to log in please

acceptanceCriteria: Users with active Internet Identity sessions are automatically authenticated on page load
No manual login action is required for users with valid sessions
The authentication check happens silently in the background during app initialization

requirements.text: Reduce the number of clicks required for Internet Identity authentication by implementing a one-click login flow that opens the Internet Identity authentication window immediately when the user clicks the sign-in button

quotes: it's still difficult to log in

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the sign-in button immediately opens Internet Identity authentication
No intermediate confirmation dialogs or additional steps are required
The login flow completes in a single user action after Internet Identity authentication

requirements.text: Add clear visual feedback during the authentication process with loading indicators that show the user their login request is being processed

quotes: it's still difficult to log in please

acceptanceCriteria: A loading spinner or progress indicator appears when login is initiated
Status messages indicate authentication is in progress
Users receive immediate feedback when authentication succeeds or fails

requirements.text: Update the LoginButton component in the App.tsx header to be more prominent with larger size, stronger visual emphasis using Betika green colors, and actionable text like 'Sign In to Play' instead of just 'Login'

quotes: Allow for the logging in it's still difficult to log in please

acceptanceCriteria: Login button is visually distinct and immediately noticeable in the header
Button uses Betika green brand colors for strong visual emphasis
Button text clearly communicates the action and benefit of signing in

constraints: Must use existing Internet Identity authentication system
Cannot modify immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx
Must maintain compatibility with existing admin access control system
nonGoals: Implementing alternative authentication methods beyond Internet Identity
Creating new user registration flows or profile setup processes
Modifying backend authentication logic or access control
